comment.text: May play a role in the formation and regulation of the tight junction (TJ) paracellular permeability barrier. It is able to induce adhesion when expressed in cells lacking tight junctions.
(Microbial infection) Acts as a co-receptor for hepatitis C virus (HCV) in hepatocytes.
Interacts with TJP1/ZO1 (PubMed:19017651). Interacts with VAPA (PubMed:10523508). Interacts with CLDN1, CLDN6, CLDN9, CLDN11, CLDN12 and CLDN17 (PubMed:20375010).
Localized at tight junctions of both epithelial and endothelial cells. Highly expressed in kidney. Not detected in testis.

The C-terminal is cytoplasmic and is important for interaction with ZO-1. Sufficient for the tight junction localization. Involved in the regulation of the permeability barrier function of the tight junction (By similarity). The first extracellular loop participates in an adhesive interaction.
Dephosphorylated by PTPRJ. The tyrosine phosphorylation on Tyr-398 and Tyr-402 reduces its ability to interact with TJP1. Phosphorylation at Ser-490 also attenuates the interaction with TJP1.

disease.name: Pseudo-TORCH syndrome 1
disease.description: An autosomal recessive neurologic disorder with characteristic clinical and neuroradiologic features that mimic intrauterine TORCH infection in the absence of evidence of infection. Affected individuals have congenital microcephaly, intracranial calcifications, and severe developmental delay.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

property.value: Apoptotic cleavage of cell adhesion proteins
RUNX1 regulates expression of components of tight junctions
Expressed in thyroid gland and 213 other tissues
P:cellular response to tumor necrosis factor
P:positive regulation of blood-brain barrier permeability
P:protein localization to cell leading edge
P:regulation of bicellular tight junction assembly

feature.description: Loss of phosphorylation and loss of regulation of TJP1 binding; when associated with A-402.

Loss of phosphorylation, almost complete loss of binding to TJP1, loss of regulation of TJP1 binding and loss of localization to plasma membrane and sites of cell-cell contact; when associated with D-402.
Loss of phosphorylation, decrease in binding to TJP1 and significant loss of regulation of TJP1 binding; when associated with F-402.
Loss of phosphorylation and loss of regulation of TJP1 binding; when associated with A-398.

Loss of localization to the tight junctions.
